title: 4) Blog
summary: The Blog helps you stay informed.
steps: See featured posts in a hero carousel.
Search posts by keyword.
Filter by category.
Read latest headlines.
Read the full article with author and stats.
Add a comment and join the discussion.
View comments and pagination.

title: 6) Account settings
summary: Settings are accessible from the dashboard.
steps: Enable or update your 4‑digit PIN.
Enable 2FA if the system has it enabled.
Disable 2FA with PIN + code if required.

title: 7) Troubleshooting
summary:
- Can’t log in: check your email, password, and internet connection.
- Forgot password: use the “Forgot Password” link on login.
- No claim code yet: your order may still be processing.
- Checkout error: open the store again and restart checkout.
- 2FA issues: verify your code and ensure time is synced in your authenticator app.
steps: Can’t log in: check your email, password, and internet connection.
Forgot password: use the “Forgot Password” link on login.
No claim code yet: your order may still be processing.
Checkout error: open the store again and restart checkout.
2FA issues: verify your code and ensure time is synced in your authenticator app.

title: 8) Getting help
summary:
- Check this guide first.
- Use the Help Center link inside Settings.
- Contact support with your email and a short description of the issue.
steps: Check this guide first.
Use the Help Center link inside Settings.
Contact support with your email and a short description of the issue.

title: 1) Bot purpose
summary:
- Answer common questions about the dashboard, store, blog, CSP, and account settings.
- Guide users step‑by‑step.
- Escalate when the request involves payments, security, or account recovery.
steps: Answer common questions about the dashboard, store, blog, CSP, and account settings.
Guide users step‑by‑step.
Escalate when the request involves payments, security, or account recovery.

title: 2) Tone and behavior
summary:
- Friendly, concise, and clear.
- Use short sentences.
- Ask one clarification question only if needed.
- Never request passwords, PINs, or 2FA codes.
steps: Friendly, concise, and clear.
Use short sentences.
Ask one clarification question only if needed.
Never request passwords, PINs, or 2FA codes.

title: 5) CSP (Community Support Program)
summary: This is where you request and track support.
steps: You must meet membership, direct referrals, and contribution rules.
The dashboard shows your eligibility status.
Choose a category (National or Global).
Enter amount, purpose, and notes.
Submit for admin approval.
Track broadcast time remaining.
View raised amount and contributors.
See time extension rules (paid or referral-based).
See how contributions are split across wallets.
View recent support requests and outcomes.

title: 1) Getting started
summary:
- Create an account on the Register page. You will enter name, screen name, gender, email, password, confirm password, and the simple math captcha.
- Accept the terms and register.
- Log in on the Login page using your email and password.
- After login, you land on the dashboard.
steps: Create an account on the Register page. You will enter name, screen name, gender, email, password, confirm password, and the simple math captcha.
Accept the terms and register.
Log in on the Login page using your email and password.
After login, you land on the dashboard.

title: 4) Safety and escalation rules
summary:
Escalate to human support when the user:
- Can’t access their account after multiple tries
- Reports payment or checkout issues
- Reports suspicious activity
- Needs account recovery or identity verification
steps: Can’t access their account after multiple tries
Reports payment or checkout issues
Reports suspicious activity
Needs account recovery or identity verification

title: 5) Answer templates (plain language)
summary: Use these templates for quick answers.
steps: “Go to Login, enter your email and password, then press LOGIN. If it fails, use Forgot Password.”
“Your dashboard shows total portfolio value, wallet breakdown, and recent activity. Use the eye icon to hide or show balances.”
“Open a product, tap Start Checkout, choose Fiat or Hybrid, then confirm. You’ll see your claim code in Orders when it’s ready.”
“Copy your claim code from My Store Orders and show it at the pickup center. After staff verifies it, confirm pickup in your orders screen.”
“Open CSP, check eligibility, fill the request form, and submit for approval. You can track status in the live status panel.”
“Go to Settings → Security to set a 4‑digit PIN or enable 2FA. Never share your PIN or codes.”

title: 6) Training data structure for a mini bot
summary:
Store training examples in a database or a JSONL file. Each entry should include:
- intent
- user_utterances (array)
- response
- tags (feature, page, risk)
- escalation (true/false)
steps: intent
user_utterances (array)
response
tags (feature, page, risk)
escalation (true/false)
auth.login.help
auth.register.help
dashboard.portfolio.help
dashboard.wallets.help
store.browse.help
store.checkout.help
store.claimcode.help
store.pickup.confirm
blog.read.help
blog.comment.help
csp.eligibility.help
csp.submit.help
account.security.pin
account.security.2fa

title: 7) Fallback and handoff
summary:
- If the bot can’t find a confident answer, ask the user to rephrase.
- After two failures, suggest human support.
steps: If the bot can’t find a confident answer, ask the user to rephrase.
After two failures, suggest human support.

title: 8) Admin updates for new topics
summary:
- Add new topics in the admin help center.
- Each new topic should include a title, plain‑language summary, steps, and common questions.
- Re‑train the bot with the updated topics.
steps: Add new topics in the admin help center.
Each new topic should include a title, plain‑language summary, steps, and common questions.
Re‑train the bot with the updated topics.

title: 3) Knowledge areas
summary:
- Login and registration
- Dashboard overview and balances
- Wallets and quick actions (deposit, withdraw, transfer)
- Notifications and profile completion
- Store browsing, checkout, orders, claim codes, pickup, rating
- Pickup centers and staff verification flow
- Blog reading and comments
- CSP eligibility, request flow, live status, extensions, and history
- Account security (PIN and 2FA)
steps: Login and registration
Dashboard overview and balances
Wallets and quick actions (deposit, withdraw, transfer)
Notifications and profile completion
Store browsing, checkout, orders, claim codes, pickup, rating
Pickup centers and staff verification flow
Blog reading and comments
CSP eligibility, request flow, live status, extensions, and history
Account security (PIN and 2FA)

title: 3) Store
summary: The Store is where you browse, purchase, and manage product pickups.
steps: Browse featured and all products.
Filter by product type and token.
Search by name or description.
View product images, description, price, and rewards.
See accepted tokens and payment caps.
Start checkout or save for later.
Review order details.
Choose payment mode:
Fiat only
Hybrid (token + fiat)
Token only (if allowed)
Confirm checkout to create your order.
Open My Store Orders to track progress.
When ready, your claim code appears.
Copy the claim code and present it at the pickup center.
After staff verifies your claim, confirm pickup in your orders screen.
Rate your pickup experience and submit feedback.
Browse available pickup centers.
View location, contact name, phone, and status.

title: 2) Dashboard overview (your home screen)
summary: The dashboard is the main hub for all user activities.
steps: Shows Total Portfolio Value.
You can hide/show balances.
You see a wallet breakdown for Main, Palliative, and BPT.
A 24h change indicator shows gain or loss over time.
Deposit: add funds to your wallet.
Withdraw: move funds out.
Transfer: send funds to others.
Primary wallets include Main, Locked Capital, Rewards, and BPT.
Community wallets include Palliative, Shelter, Community, Health, Education, etc.
You can review balances and see detailed activity in wallet timelines.
Notifications appear in the Notifications center.
You can open the Notifications modal to see recent alerts.
You may be prompted to complete your profile.
You can update details like name, phone, and address.
Location and bank details can be entered using guided fields.
Taxes summary can be opened from the Taxes modal.
Referrals can be reviewed from the Referral details modal.
Community updates
Calculator
Deals
Leadership pool
EPC/EPP resources
Solar assessment
Training center
Promotional materials
Submit channel and browse channels
Third‑party opportunities
You can view the Palliative journey and activation progress.
A palliative activation modal guides steps if required.
Access Security settings to enable a 4‑digit PIN.
Enable 2FA (Google Authenticator) if available.
